Mission 01

Greatest Common Factor

Mission 01: Greatest Common Factor

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A Tutorial Gate has been detected. Difficulty: E-Rank. Hunter, this is your first test. Prove your worth.

The Challenge Awaits

Welcome, young Hunter. Before you can face the monsters in higher-rank dungeons, you must first master the fundamental skills that all elite Hunters possess. Today, you enter the Tutorial Gate: Number Foundations.

Your mission? Learn to identify the Greatest Common Factor (GCF) - a technique that allows you to break down any number into its core components. Think of it like analyzing a monster's weaknesses before battle. Every number has factors - smaller numbers that divide into it evenly. Finding the GCF between two numbers is like finding the strongest common weakness between two enemies.

‚öîÔ∏è Hunter Equipment

Gather these items before entering the dungeon: - 80 identical items (Cheerios, beans, pennies, blocks, or Legos work great) - Two dice (your random number generators) - A pencil and scratch paper (for battle calculations)

üìú Skills to Unlock

Common Core Standard 6.NS.4 (Part 1) I can find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12.

Common Core Standard 6.NS.4 (Part 2) Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1-100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor. Example: Express 36 + 8 as 4(9 + 2)

üéì Training Scrolls

Before entering the dungeon, study these ancient scrolls:

  • Greatest Common Factor Video
  • Using Greatest Common Factor | CK-12 Foundation
  • Using Least Common Multiple | CK-12 Foundation

Understanding Factors: A Hunter's Guide

What exactly is a factor? A factor is any number that divides evenly into another number with no remainder.

Think of it this way: if you have 12 gold coins from a dungeon raid, you could split them: - Into 1 pile of 12 coins - Into 2 piles of 6 coins each - Into 3 piles of 4 coins each - Into 4 piles of 3 coins each - Into 6 piles of 2 coins each - Into 12 piles of 1 coin each

So the factors of 12 are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12

What is the Greatest Common Factor? When you compare two numbers and list all their factors, the GCF is the largest number that appears in both lists. It's the "common ground" - like finding the strongest skill that two Hunters both possess.

Pro Hunter Tip: The GCF is extremely useful! It helps you simplify fractions, distribute items equally, and solve complex problems more easily.

üè∞ Dungeon Raid

üìú Official Quest Instructions

You are going to need several pieces of scratch paper today, a pencil and two dice. Split your first piece of paper into half. Roll your two dice and multiply the two dice and write the product at the top of one side of the paper, for example if you roll a two and a four - write 8. Roll your dice again and write the product on the top of the other side of the paper. You are going to find the greatest common factor of these two numbers. To find the factors you are looking for what numbers can be multiplied together to get that number. You can do this by gathering that number of items and splitting them into even piles and writing down the number in each pile. For example if your number was 12. You could make 1 pile of 12, 2 piles or 6, 3 piles of 4 - so you would write the factors as 1,2,3,4,6,12. Do the same thing with your second number. For example if it is 18, the factors would be 1,2,3,6,9,18. To find the greatest common factor, you circle the biggest number that the two sides have in common. In this case it is 6. Repeat the activity several times.

üí° Raid Strategy Guide

Follow this step-by-step battle plan to conquer the dungeon:

Step 1: Prepare Your Battlefield

Take a piece of scratch paper and draw a vertical line down the middle to create two columns - LEFT and RIGHT.

Step 2: Generate Your First Number (Left Side)

Roll both dice and multiply the numbers together. - Example: You roll a 3 and a 4 ‚Üí 3 √ó 4 = 12 - Write "12" at the top of the LEFT column

Step 3: Generate Your Second Number (Right Side)

Roll both dice again and multiply. - Example: You roll a 3 and a 6 ‚Üí 3 √ó 6 = 18 - Write "18" at the top of the RIGHT column

Step 4: Find All Factors (The Core Technique)

This is where your items come in! Count out the exact number of items matching your first number (12 items).

Test each split: - Can you make 1 pile? Yes! (1 pile of 12) ‚Üí Write down 1 and 12 - Can you make 2 equal piles? Yes! (2 piles of 6) ‚Üí Write down 2 and 6 - Can you make 3 equal piles? Yes! (3 piles of 4) ‚Üí Write down 3 and 4 - Can you make 5 equal piles? No! (12 √∑ 5 has a remainder)

Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12

Step 5: Find Factors of the Second Number

Repeat the process with your second number (18 items).

Factors of 18: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18

Step 6: Identify the Champion (GCF)

Compare both lists and circle every number that appears on BOTH sides: - 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12 - 18: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18

Common factors: 1, 2, 3, 6

The GREATEST Common Factor = 6 (the biggest circled number!)

Step 7: Repeat for Mastery

Complete this process at least 3-5 more times with different dice rolls. Each repetition makes you stronger!

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro starting Mission 01 about Greatest Common Factor.
I need to master GCF before I can attempt my assignment.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain what factors are using simple examples
2. Show me how to find the GCF of two numbers
3. Give me 3 practice problems and check my answers
4. Quiz me with a Boss Challenge problem
5. Have me explain GCF back to you in my own words

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
Start by explaining what a factor is like I'm a new E-Rank hunter.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

  • [ ] The GCF is correctly identified (the LARGEST number common to both lists)
  • [ ] They completed the verbatim quest instructions in Section 4
  • [ ] They reviewed at least one Training Scroll (lesson video)
  • [ ] They repeated the activity multiple times as instructed
